John Francis Sheehan (1910-1942) was a United States Navy sailor killed in action during World War II for whom a destroyer escort was named during the war.

David Allen Russell was killed in action as a brigadier general in the Union Army.

Lieutenant Commander MacKenzie was killed in action 15 March 1943 when three Japanese destroyers sank Triton in waters just north of the Admiralty Islands.

A Democrat closely involved in Pennsylvania politics, Samuel W. Black is best known for being the 7th Governor of the Nebraska Territory and for being killed in action leading his regiment in a charge early in the Civil War.

During the Great Sioux War, George Edwin Lord accompanied Lt. Col. George Armstrong Custer's column towards the Little Bighorn River, where he was killed in action.

Josef Kahl was killed in action during World War II.

Frank Edward Stubbs was killed in action on 25 April 1915 while landing on W Beach in Cape Helles, Gallipoli, Turkey.

Maynard W. Tollberg (1904-1943) was a United States Navy sailor killed in action during World War II.
Hunter Marshall III (1917-1942) was a United States Navy officer killed in action during World War II who received the Silver Star posthumously for his actions.
